oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: The Same Boat, Brother Sheet Music
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: An original four-page song sheet for "The Same Boat, Brother" by E.Y. Harburg and Earl Robinson.

E. Y. Harburg and Earl Robinson wrote "The Same Boat, Brother" following the destruction of World War II as a call for unity. It was popularized in the United States by Huddie William "Lead Belly" Ledbetter, a folk and blues singer, and internationally by Indian singer Bhupen Hazarika. Pete Seeger notes Lead Belly as one of his influences.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: E.Y. Harburg; Earl Robinson
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Leadbelly, 1885-1949; Folk music; Highlander Folk School (Monteagle, Tenn.); Working class--Education; Working class--Songs and music; Labor movement; Labor movement--United States--History; African Americans--Civil rights--Songs and music
